subject: What’s New at Zoom | January 2025 Recap
body:
In 2025, be more efficient with Zoom’s AI Companion. Dear Valued Customer, As Zoom evolves, we want to help you stay up to date on how the latest products and features can help you work and collaborate
 
In 2025, be more efficient with Zoom’s AI Companion. 
 
Dear Valued Customer,
 
  
As Zoom evolves, we want to help you stay up to date on how the latest products and features can help you work and collaborate better. We’ll outline some highlights below, including opportunities for further learning.
 
  
To get more detailed information about the latest releases, here are a few resources: 
 
Zoom Digital Customer Success Hub
 - This event hub is full of training and information sessions hosted by the Zoom Digital Customer Success team. 
 
What’s New at Zoom blog
 - The blog is a great spot to keep up with Zoom, and the What’s New post is regularly updated with info about new products and features. 
 
Preview notes
 - A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
 
Release notes
 - A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
 
  
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please reply directly to this email.
 
 
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers.
 
Events & Training
Zoom Contact Center Insights: Success Stories & New Feature Deep Dives -
 
Register now
 
to learn more about the latest ZCC features and how they can help you streamline your data center operations. 
 
In 2025, be more efficient with Zoom’s AI Companion
 
You may have heard about Zoom’s AI Companion 2.0 when we announced it last year during Zoomtopia. To help you work and collaborate more effectively in 2025, we wanted to take a closer look at this included* tool and how you can implement it within your organization. 
 
Ask AI Companion questions about what has happened in a meeting to quickly catch up!
 
What is AI Companion 2.0?
AI Companion 2.0 is your next-generation AI assistant that surfaces important information in a convenient side panel, helping you prioritize what matters most and providing suggestions to help you stay on top of your work. With this tool, you can: 
 
Use prompt suggestions and generate answers from AI Companion
 via a convenient side panel across Zoom Workplace, including Zoom Meetings, Zoom Team Chat, Zoom Docs, Zoom Calendar, and Zoom Mail. 
 
Expand the context of information.
 
AI Companion helps you stay organized and on top of your day because it has context from your data generated across Zoom Workplace, including your Zoom Meetings and, when connected, information from Microsoft Outlook, Gmail, Google Calendar, and uploaded files from Microsoft Office and Google Docs. AI Companion remembers previous conversations you’ve had within the side panel and interactions from across Zoom Workplace.
 
Generate next steps from a meeting summary
 and, coming soon, AI Companion will be able to automatically turn those next steps into Zoom Tasks to help keep teams aligned and on track to deliver projects on time. Keep an eye out for the release of Zoom Tasks in the near future. 
 
Summarize unread messages within a Zoom Team Chat channel
 to easily stay up to date on team conversations and avoid getting bogged down in unread chats. Within the new home tab, AI Companion will be able to provide users with a list of updates based on unread chats and emails.
 
Recap email threads
 in Zoom Mail
 without having to read every message.
 
 
The AI Companion side panel in the Zoom Workplace app can help answer your questions. Use the prompts or ask your own!
 
How do I manage AI Companion 2.0 for my account?
 
As an account admin or owner, you can control AI Companion features in the Zoom web portal. You can choose to enable or disable AI Companion features for all users on the account or specific groups of users. Individual users can also enable or disable some AI features for their own use, if not locked by an admin at the account or group level. For more details, see our support article on 
how to enable or disable Zoom AI Companion features
.
 
How do I help my users get started?
 
Making sure AI Companion 2.0 is enabled is the first step, but users may need some guidance on how to get the most out of this new tool. We recommend providing them with resources from the 
AI Companion Onboarding Center
.
 
This library is open to all and can be filtered by product and asset type to help you find what you need fast. You can view, download, and share setup guides, demo videos, email templates to introduce your end users to AI Companion, and more. 
 
*Included at no additional cost with the paid services assigned to Zoom user accounts. AI Companion may not be available for all regions and industry verticals.
 
Service Updates
 
Zoom firewall settings -
 
Zoom is continuously optimizing our global footprint to improve performance and availability for our customers. Customers should not need to perform any active changes provided they are following the guidance as provided in our support article 
“Network Firewall Settings for CRC and Enhanced API Connector.”
 For any questions or concerns, please contact your account team or 
Zoom Support
.
 
Catch us on social 
 
You're receiving this email because you are a Zoom customer. 
If you wish to be removed from our email list, 
unsubscribe
 or 
manage your email preferences.

subject: RE: Meeting with Sr Leadership/Next steps and LCW announcement
body:
Oh wow! Thanks for letting me know Patricia. I wish you well and hope our paths will cross again soon.
 
Chuck let me know how you would like to proceed with our plans with LCW in 2025.
 
Thank you.
 
Stephen R. Cornejo Garcia 
(He, Him, El)
Global Head of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI)
 
Stephen.CornejoGarcia@ul.com
UL Solutions

 Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>

 Monday, February 3, 2025 7:09 PM

 Cornejo Garcia, Stephen R. <Stephen.CornejoGarcia@ul.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Meeting with Sr Leadership/Next steps and LCW announcement
 
Dear Stephen,
 
I hope this message finds you well. 
 
I wanted to personally share an update regarding my professional journey. As of February 5th, I will no longer be with LCW in my current role of 
Senior Consultant managing your account
. 
 
However, I am excited to be returning to facilitation and coaching contract work, as I was before this important project.
I greatly value our collaboration and look forward to all parties staying in touch as we all navigate challenging times for D.E.I. work in the US, impacting the world.
 
Please follow 
LCW 
great initiatives at  
www.linkedin.com/company/lcwinclusion/
and feel free follow me as well as we all make this world a better place: 
 Patricia Malidor-Coleman | LinkedIn
 
Effective immediately, Chuck hereby copied should be contacted so 
LCW
 can support you moving forward on 
UL SOLUTIONS 
pending account activities and when you are ready for the new 
CCLP
 and the 
2025 GLOBAL FORUM.
 
Wishing you continued success, and I hope our paths cross again soon!
 
Sincerely,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

Regarding ownership of work product (our content), if you can agree via mail, we would not need to sign any other agreement:
 
1.
                  
LCW retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property (referred to herein as “LCW IP”) in existence prior to the execution of this Agreement, and any new IP that is a derivative of LCW’s existing IP. No copyrightable or other Work Product created or provided by LCW pursuant to this Agreement is to be considered a work made for hire by Supplier, unless otherwise stated in an SOW. 
2.
                  
CLIENT retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property in existence prior to this agreement, including IP that may be incorporated by LCW into customized services or deliverables for CLIENT. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks so much!
Nicole

subject: next steps and  announcement re: LCW invoice #25005/THANKS
body:
Dear Sean,
 
I hope this message finds you well. 
 
First of all, let me update you that Tatyana and Olga are doing well and nearly halfway the new series of Executive Coaching sessions.
 
I wanted to personally share an update regarding my professional journey. As of February 5th, I will no longer be with LCW in my current role of Senior Consultant managing your account. 
 
However, I am excited to be returning to facilitation and coaching contract work, as I was before this important project.
I greatly value our collaboration and look forward to all parties staying in touch as we all navigate challenging times for D.E.I. work.
 
Please follow LCW
 
great initiatives at  
www.linkedin.com/company/lcwinclusion/

subject: Re: Upcoming Online Availability Changes
body:
Hi team I am struggling with a fever I will be taking the day to recover.
Thanks.
Get 
Outlook for iOS
From:
 Juri Mansour <j.mansour@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, January 28, 2025 11:53:32 PM
To:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>; Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>; Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>; Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Catalina De Sanctis <c.desanctis@lcwmail.com>; Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>; Keri Luo <k.luo@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Upcoming Online Availability Changes
 
 
Hi All,
As previously communicated, I will be adjusting my hours today to accommodate a couple meetings outside of my Tuesday work hours so I will be logging off at 10am EST to accommodate those meetings.  
Thanks!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW
From:
 Juri Mansour
Sent:
 Friday, January 24, 2025 4:05 AM
To:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>; Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>; Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>; Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Catalina De Sanctis <c.desanctis@lcwmail.com>; Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Upcoming Online Availability Changes
 
 
Hello team,
Today going forward I will be limited in being online on Tuesdays and Fridays with hours being 8-11 am EST. The rest of the days I'll be online from 8am-12pm EST.  Tuesday's schedule is temporary just for the next month. I will let you know if that changes.
I will be flexible on days that client meetings must happen outside of these hours and adjust those days online availability to accommodate those meetings. 
Any one-on-one meetings will be ad hoc. 
As always if you need to reach me regarding an urgent need that cannot wait or be delegated you can reach me on WhatsApp: 703-504-8519
And text at 6572240067.
If you need me to be available online at later times in a day, please reach out to me and I will work with you. 
I am still sick with my respiratory system being mainly affected. I have never been this sick so I would appreciate your patience with me. I am functional though my ability to speak will be limited until I recover more hopefully sooner rather than later. I will reserve my speaking for client meetings and on rest of meetings I will reply in chat unless absolutely necessary to speak.
Thank you for your understanding & patience. And again please reach out to me if you would like to work with me on adjusting my availability for particular days even if it's just one offs.
Juri
Get 
Outlook for iOS

Subject:
 Patricia's future LCW engagement 
 
Dear esteemed team,
 
As my Sr Consultant agreement hits the one year anniversary mark this week and due to LCW current financial situation, I have had courageous conversations with Chuck and Nicole where I expressed the strong desire to revert to my original LCW relationship status of 
External Facilitator and Coach
 when needed especially as I bring well needed Global Lenses to the table when Cultural Competence, Global Leadership and Intercultural Communication need to win what D.E.I will lose with clients as they too transition in these challenging times.
 
My clients:
UL Solutions
Colgate Palmolive 
Sony International 
Ubisoft UAE 
 
have pending engagement and/or invoices which I hope will come through to support accounts payable.
 
I am NOT available January 29
th
 through 31
st
 and will do a final sweep on Monday in DropBox to make sure everything is updated properly with most recent communication with clients. I am doing so Pro Bono in goodwill and gratitude for the opportunity I had to make a difference at LCW.
 
My LCW email will be retired as of next week. I can be reached at 
pcoleman@azworldconnections.com
.
 
It has been a pleasure working with all of you in my Sr Consultant capacity and I know our path will, must cross again as we continue doing this important work!   
 
All the best~
 
 
  
 
Patricia M Coleman

Sent:
 Monday, January 13, 2025 3:00 PM
To:
 Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: Ideas for the CCLP
 
Last correspondence…
 
From:
 Sarah Nodarse 
Sent:
 Friday, December 13, 2024 1:36 PM
To:
 Cornejo Garcia, Stephen R. <
Stephen.CornejoGarcia@ul.com
>; Dodson, Jermisha Y. <
Jermisha.Dodson@ul.com
>
Subject:
 Ideas for the CCLP
 
Hi Stephen and Jermisha, 
 
Happy Friday the 13
th
, I hope it’s a lucky day for both of you.
 
It was great speaking with you earlier in the week about your plans for the CCLP and manager certification in 2025. I was happy to present the regionalization and licensing approaches to you. As you recall, we discussed ways to make the program digestible for busy managers and also ways to ensure that the regional rollouts were thoroughly relevant to each region. As promised, here are some ideas we discussed.
 
Consultation and discovery are essential to getting the regional nuances right so that the program has the desired impact outside of the USA. A big part of the project launch will be identifying and consulting with regional stakeholders, who will weigh in not only on the content, but on the content, cadence, and context of the delivery. We will want to organize 1-2 strategy session with key stakeholders and several listening sessions with regional employees across various population groups.
These elements of the CCLP program can be customized for regional relevance:
Content – 
                                                              
i.
      
Concepts and examples used in the lessons can be adapted to regional realities; 
                                                             
ii.
      
We can deliver fewer lessons, e.g., 5 instead of 7, and this number can be different per region
Cadence – lessons can be spaced out with 3-4 weeks in between, or sped up with only 1 week in between 
Context – the CCLP, behavior boosts and practicum constitute 3 modules of a comprehensive program that can be combined together or deployed separately in the different regions, depending on need and appetite. For example, a region may decide to ONLY do the behavior boosts, while another does everything (7-lesson CCLP, 12 behavior boosts, and a practicum), and another does a 4-lesson CCLP with 4 behavior boosts and a practicum
I think that was it, let me know if you remember something else that I don’t mention here.
 
In the meantime, I hope you have a great weekend! 
 
Thanks,
Sarah
 
 
Sarah Nodarse
(she/her)
Principal Consultant
LCW
4753 N Broadway, Flr. 2
Chicago, IL 60640
 
773-828-6781 (office)
773-474-9138 (direct)
s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
 
Website | Twitter | Facebook | LinkedIn
View our upcoming events | Sign-up for our newsletter
 
I live and work in Chicago, IL – on the unceded territory of the Pokagon band of Potawatomi. See 
this article
 in the Chicago History Museum Magazine for a native perspective on land acknowledgements and the City of Chicago.

ii.
      
We can deliver fewer lessons, e.g., 5 instead of 7, and this number can be different per region
Cadence – lessons can be spaced out with 3-4 weeks in between, or sped up with only 1 week in between 
Context – the CCLP, behavior boosts and practicum constitute 3 modules of a comprehensive program that can be combined together or deployed separately in the different regions, depending on need and appetite. For example, a region may decide to ONLY do the behavior boosts, while another does everything (7-lesson CCLP, 12 behavior boosts, and a practicum), and another does a 4-lesson CCLP with 4 behavior boosts and a practicum
I think that was it, let me know if you remember something else that I don’t mention here.
 
In the meantime, I hope you have a great weekend! 
 
Thanks,
Sarah
 
 
Sarah Nodarse
(she/her)
Principal Consultant
LCW
4753 N Broadway, Flr. 2
Chicago, IL 60640
 
773-828-6781 (office)
773-474-9138 (direct)
s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
 
Website | Twitter | Facebook | LinkedIn
View our upcoming events | Sign-up for our newsletter
 
I live and work in Chicago, IL – on the unceded territory of the Pokagon band of Potawatomi. See 
this article
 in the Chicago History Museum Magazine for a native perspective on land acknowledgements and the City of Chicago.

Regarding ownership of work product (our content), if you can agree via mail, we would not need to sign any other agreement:

LCW retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property (referred to herein as “LCW IP”) in existence prior to the execution of this Agreement, and any new IP that is a derivative of LCW’s existing IP. Please let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks so much!
Nicole

Hello Patricia :
 
I am copying Jesma to bring her into the loop & please see my comments in blue to your questions:
 
1.
   
First, as I am reviewing original SOW to determine budget. I see that tittle is “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition" vs “Rewards & Recognition”. The latter came up during our last call. Recognition=Praises, email, public announcements but Rewards= Tangible perks in addition to salary. When discuss goals, objectives and outcomes expected we can confirm. 
I will say we should  keep the title as Managing Bias in Rewards & Recogntion" since internally we usually talk about Rewards & Recognition and not Compensation & Recognition but  we will definitely discuss the  specific content to be included.

The sooner the better , so ideally Q1 still not an specific date
3.
   
Who will benefit from this ML, current employees, or new hire ONLY?  
Current employees
 
See you at the meeting!
 
Best,

subject: Next steps/ project on hold-Rewards & Recognition microlearning-Colgate Palmolive
body:
Dear Claudia and Jesma,
 
Following up after our meeting today January 28
th
 when we were informed that the LCW NEW ML R&R project needs to be delayed by a few weeks (Date TBD) as discussions internally are taking place regarding new DEI initiatives pushed back since 01/20/25 new US government administration.
 
Chuck Adams, LCW CEO was in attendance in this meeting and shared that we are all impacted by this rather radical move especially for government funded programs.  We have hope that the private sector keeps its initiatives as they are crucial to do business globally successfully.
 
LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE
 is on your side to assist in adjusting the language in content to continue meeting the objectives of all products.
 
I have copied Nicole Barile, LCW COO, who will part of the discussion around the development of this new ML.
 
Next steps:
 
Chuck will follow up mid-February.
Juri ‘s timeline is ready and awaiting your Reward Department input.
ML design & development team is ready to go and awaiting your green light. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: Moving forward please address all emails to Chuck cc: Nicole and Juri as I am transitioning to facilitation and coaching duties ONLY and will not be leading this project.  I look forward one day to reconnect in a virtual workshop or in person session 
😉
 
Thank you for your partnership,
 
Sincerely,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  and Global Diversity Facilitator
LCW

I will say we should  keep the title as Managing Bias in Rewards & Recogntion" since internally we usually talk about Rewards & Recognition and not Compensation & Recognition but  we will definitely discuss the  specific content to be included.

I am confirming that we are OK agreeing to this purchase order:
 
https://www.sonypictures.com/corp/purchaseorder_tac.html
 
I know you are looking into payment terms. We would love 30 days 
🙂
 (our standard terms), but 45 days works for us as well.
 
Regarding ownership of work product (our content), if you can agree via mail, we would not need to sign any other agreement:
 
1.
                  
LCW retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property (referred to herein as “LCW IP”) in existence prior to the execution of this Agreement, and any new IP that is a derivative of LCW’s existing IP. No copyrightable or other Work Product created or provided by LCW pursuant to this Agreement is to be considered a work made for hire by Supplier, unless otherwise stated in an SOW. 
2.
                  
CLIENT retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property in existence prior to this agreement, including IP that may be incorporated by LCW into customized services or deliverables for CLIENT. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks so much!
Nicole

subject: Re: Upcoming Online Availability Changes
body:
Hi All,
As previously communicated, I will be adjusting my hours today to accommodate a couple meetings outside of my Tuesday work hours so I will be logging off at 10am EST to accommodate those meetings.  
Thanks!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW
From:
 Juri Mansour
Sent:
 Friday, January 24, 2025 4:05 AM
To:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>; Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>; Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>; Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Catalina De Sanctis <c.desanctis@lcwmail.com>; Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Upcoming Online Availability Changes
 
 
Hello team,
Today going forward I will be limited in being online on Tuesdays and Fridays with hours being 8-11 am EST. The rest of the days I'll be online from 8am-12pm EST.  Tuesday's schedule is temporary just for the next month. I will let you know if that changes.
I will be flexible on days that client meetings must happen outside of these hours and adjust those days online availability to accommodate those meetings. 
Any one-on-one meetings will be ad hoc. 
As always if you need to reach me regarding an urgent need that cannot wait or be delegated you can reach me on WhatsApp: 703-504-8519
And text at 6572240067.
If you need me to be available online at later times in a day, please reach out to me and I will work with you. 
I am still sick with my respiratory system being mainly affected. I have never been this sick so I would appreciate your patience with me. I am functional though my ability to speak will be limited until I recover more hopefully sooner rather than later. I will reserve my speaking for client meetings and on rest of meetings I will reply in chat unless absolutely necessary to speak.
Thank you for your understanding & patience. And again please reach out to me if you would like to work with me on adjusting my availability for particular days even if it's just one offs.
Juri

body:
Hi Nicole
 
Good to meet you too! Happy to confirm these two points on IP by email.
Thanks
Neeta

Subject:
 Re: LCW invoice #24326/SONY INTERNATIONAL
 
Caution: External Email
 
Hi Neeta,
 
It was nice meeting you!
 
I am confirming that we are OK agreeing to this purchase order:
 
https://www.sonypictures.com/corp/purchaseorder_tac.html
 
I know you are looking into payment terms. We would love 30 days 
🙂
 (our standard terms), but 45 days works for us as well.
 
Regarding ownership of work product (our content), if you can agree via mail, we would not need to sign any other agreement:
 
1.
                  
LCW retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property (referred to herein as “LCW IP”) in existence prior to the execution of this Agreement, and any new IP that is a derivative of LCW’s existing IP. No copyrightable or other Work Product created or provided by LCW pursuant to this Agreement is to be considered a work made for hire by Supplier, unless otherwise stated in an SOW. 
2.
                  
CLIENT retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property in existence prior to this agreement, including IP that may be incorporated by LCW into customized services or deliverables for CLIENT. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks so much!
Nicole

Hello Juri,
Thanks for the proposed schedule.
In order for me to confirm everything, I would need information about the exact scope.
I understand you will need:
Translation of English approved content. In which languages? The 5 we did before?
How many total word? Do you estimate around 5000 like the ones we did before?
Are there any PDF that will need translation?
Do you have the English video you can share with me so I can quote English VO?
Will you need other languages VO and subtitle?
I would be able to confirm on translation timeline and VO/Subtitle timeline. But cannot guarantee on implementation (putting all localized content on the microlearning) since that, according to what I understand, would be in the hands of Arvinder.
 
Please let me know and I would work on it ASAP. I would send you cost and TAT estimate.
Thanks!
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Importance:
 High
 
Hi team,
 
I have attached a baseline schedule built for the 
English
 
Micro Learning/ Rewards & Recognition
 and need to gain clarity on durations for some tasks that are on the critical path to see if we can reign in the schedule to ensure delivery of 
3/28.
 
 
As Patricia OOO, 
@Chuck Adams
 can you please review, provide comments or approval?
 
Also, once the below items have been addressed, I will update with schedule edits & Gantt along with any comments you have and send to the client. Please note, I am offline within the next hour and 10 min so if I do not see responses within that time I could log back on, update & send by 1/27 6/7pm EST. 
 
If that is too late , could you please implement the changes that come through and send to the client? Alternatively if there is more that needs to be discussed before sending to Claudia, could you request more time & we can review & send the baseline timeline to ColPal tomorrow .
 
 
Critical Path-Tasks Impacting Schedule delivery of 3/28 :
 
V1 Build-8d
V1  feedback implemented-4d
V2 feedback implemented-4d
Narration recorded-5d
Narration implemented/Final Version finalized - 5d
 
With above tasks on the CP & having a US Holiday in Feb (2/17 Presidents day )
the current delivery is 4/4.
 
@
@Arvinder Kaur
 & 
@Chuck Adams
 can you confirm if 8 days is for the V1 build & 4 days per feedback implementation is valid or can the duration be reduced?
 
@Catalina De Sanctis
, could you confirm if 10 days for VO recording & implementation is accurate? It would be great if recording the English VO & implementation into the ML can be turned around in less than 10 days.
 
Thank you all! 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

th

Subject:
 Client's Response -: Work Breakdown: ColPal Micro Learning/ Rewards & Recognition
 
Good morning, Evening ladies,
 
Here is client’s response (Claudia/HR). Chuck advised we will discuss on ALL STAFF MEETING TODAY.
Indeed, tittle MATTERS. Glad we caught it.
 
 
Hello Patricia :
 
I am copying Jesma to bring her into the loop & please see my comments in blue to your questions:
 
1.
   
First, as I am reviewing original SOW to determine budget. I see that tittle is “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition" vs “Rewards & Recognition”. The latter came up during our last call. Recognition=Praises, email, public announcements but Rewards= Tangible perks in addition to salary. When discuss goals, objectives and outcomes expected we can confirm. 
I will say we should  keep the title as Managing Bias in Rewards & Recogntion" since internally we usually talk about Rewards & Recognition and not Compensation & Recognition but  we will definitely discuss the  specific content to be included.
2.
   
We spoke about Q1 to work on this ML. Do you have launch date in mind in Q1 or Q2? 
The sooner the better , so ideally Q1 still not an specific date
3.
   
Who will benefit from this ML, current employees, or new hire ONLY?  
Current employees
 
See you at the meeting!
 
Best,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

Hi Team,
 
Below is the first draft of the work breakdown to lift this microlearning build from scratch. Please provide your feedback in a different color.  We can certainly break each milestone/task further into subtasks so we can provide the best calrity to the client in their project plan. 
 
@Arvinder Kaur

TENTATIVE-High Level Tasks to create & deliver ML from Scratch:
1.client needs analysis
2.Research
3.Content creation-word doc-
4.Client content review & approval of outline
5. Edit according to feedback
5.Send word doc to 
AK
 who will then scope design
6.Incorporate approved content into ML build-RISE 
AK
 
DON’T WE WANT AK TO DELIVER ENGLISH ML FIRST before #7???

AK
8.Translations QA
9.Submit changes to course content back to programmer for review-
AK
10.Programmer incorporates changes-
AK
11.Final translations approval
12.Submit final files to client
 
Once this is finalized, I'll revise and input into a project plan with timeline.
Please provide feedback by
 EOD Tuesday
Thanks!
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)

Hello Patricia :
 
I am copying Jesma to bring her into the loop & please see my comments in blue to your questions:
 
1.
   
First, as I am reviewing original SOW to determine budget. I see that tittle is “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition" vs “Rewards & Recognition”. The latter came up during our last call. Recognition=Praises, email, public announcements but Rewards= Tangible perks in addition to salary. When discuss goals, objectives and outcomes expected we can confirm. 
I will say we should  keep the title as Managing Bias in Rewards & Recogntion" since internally we usually talk about Rewards & Recognition and not Compensation & Recognition but  we will definitely discuss the  specific content to be included.
2.
   
We spoke about Q1 to work on this ML. Do you have launch date in mind in Q1 or Q2? 
The sooner the better , so ideally Q1 still not an specific date
3.
   
Who will benefit from this ML, current employees, or new hire ONLY? Current employees
 
@Jesma Johnson
 any additional comment ?
 
Regards,

subject: RE: ATTN: Chuck NEW SOW SIGNATURE NEEDED Follow up after today's call/Friday 8:30am EST F/U Rewards & Recognition microlearning-Colgate Palmolive
body:
I do not know what she wants to address and wish she had listed questions or update based on what was discussed. 
Meeting would be before the one I have set for you and I because it falls into Juri’s availability.  If you can’t, it’s ok as I can gather information and report to you.
If Claudia requests a different time, then feel free to respond as I really want to focus on file updates where needed. Ie: SpencerStuart, done!
Chuck, when we meet tomorrow, I will further explain why I have come to decision that I no longer want to be in client management and prefer to revert to Facilitation and Coaching where needed.
 
I urge you to assign ColPal internally as it is outside of my skillset. The first wave of 5 ML were a stretch and I all I desire is quality and efficiency for LCW.
 
The other clients are not as urgent, and I am sure you will find a solution within FT team.
 
I truly hope you understand! 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

From:
 Patricia Coleman <

> 
Sent:
 Monday, January 27, 2025 8:54 AM
To:
 Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>; pcoleman azworldconnections.com <
pcoleman@azworldconnections.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Patricia Engagement
 
Good morning, Chuck,
 
Thank you once again for the time and effort you put into drafting the SOW monetary percentage-based engagement. I truly appreciate the trust you’ve placed in me and the meaningful work we’ve accomplished together over the past year.
 
After thoughtful reflection, I have decided that I will not be able to accept this opportunity as presented although I applaud you on the creativity to come up with this plan.
 
While I deeply value the experiences and opportunities, I’ve had at LCW, I believe that the proposed engagement does not align with my professional goals, expertise, or the financial sustainability I require.
 
I understand the financial challenges LCW is navigating, and I admire the resilience and dedication being shown during these times. 
 
In light of this, I believe reverting to my prior engagement structure (before the Senior Consultant offer in January 2024) is the best fit for my skillset and bottom line. This structure enables me to bring the greatest value as a facilitator, trainer, speaker, and executive coach, leveraging my IDI Q.A. certification and extensive experience.
 
I recognize that the agreement signed a year ago has now expired on January 24th. To ensure a smooth transition, I will take the time this week to clean up files, update Dropbox, and prepare a final update on all clients which at this time should be managed by the Full-time team and not external consultants.
 
I will do this 
pro bono
 in the next 48hrs as a gesture of goodwill and appreciation for our time working together.
 
Please note: My out-of-office message for my LCW email is active and professionally directs senders to you, as has been done in the past when I’ve been unavailable.
 
This decision was not made lightly, and I hope it will be respected. I am grateful for the opportunities I’ve had to contribute to LCW and the trust you’ve shown in me.
 
I look forward to staying connected and wish you and the entire LCW team the best as you move forward.
 
Respectfully,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

Subject:
 RE: Patricia Engagement
 
Good morning Chuck,
 
Thank you for sharing the offer to transition my current Sr Consultant agreement to a project-based engagement. I truly value the opportunity to work with LCW in my current role as an external consultant yet being included as part of the FT team in pipeline work past and to come. I very much appreciate your trust in my skill set and beyond.
 
This is an important decision, and I would like to take the weekend to carefully evaluate the details of the proposal as today January 24
th
 is my last retainer compensation day.
Based on offer it will end my 1 year  agreement which started end of January 2024 which would have marked a one year anniversary if I were full time. 
 
 
I’ll provide you with my response by Monday January 27 early morning before any meeting you may have with members of FT team to announce my new status and impact on work load. 
 
 
Thank you for your understanding and the continued opportunity to make a difference.
 
 
Best regards,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant

Patricia keeps open SOWs & clients below.

Aug.2025 - Patricia gets $3,400 when ML billed (Colgate)
Aug.2026 - Patricia gets $3,200 when ML billed (Colgate)
TBD - Patricia gets $2,160 when Spotlights are billed (Sony)
For any new SOWs from these clients, she will get 20% of the SOW (minus COGS).

For IDIs,
 Individual: 
???

???
For facilitation
, Patricia would be expected to lead facilitations on her own SOWs (where appropriate) as part of the 20% payment. LCW could pay her up to $250 per hour for facilitation outside of her own SOWs.
 
Please let me know if I captured anything incorrectly or incompletely. We will need to talk about UL if they come back in the next few days with the CCLP and Global Forum.

subject: RE: COLPALNEW  ML TIMELINE DUE TODAY  following client's meeting and response -: Work Breakdown: ColPal Micro Learning/ Rewards & Recognition
body:
Hello Juri,
Thanks for the proposed schedule.
In order for me to confirm everything, I would need information about the exact scope.
I understand you will need:
Translation of English approved content. In which languages? The 5 we did before?
How many total word? Do you estimate around 5000 like the ones we did before?
Are there any PDF that will need translation?
Do you have the English video you can share with me so I can quote English VO?
Will you need other languages VO and subtitle?
I would be able to confirm on translation timeline and VO/Subtitle timeline. But cannot guarantee on implementation (putting all localized content on the microlearning) since that, according to what I understand, would be in the hands of Arvinder.
 
Please let me know and I would work on it ASAP. I would send you cost and TAT estimate.
Thanks!
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hi team,
 
I have attached a baseline schedule built for the 
English
 
Micro Learning/ Rewards & Recognition
 and need to gain clarity on durations for some tasks that are on the critical path to see if we can reign in the schedule to ensure delivery of 
3/28.
 
 
As Patricia OOO, 
@Chuck Adams
 can you please review, provide comments or approval?
 
Also, once the below items have been addressed, I will update with schedule edits & Gantt along with any comments you have and send to the client. Please note, I am offline within the next hour and 10 min so if I do not see responses within that time I could log back on, update & send by 1/27 6/7pm EST. 
 
If that is too late , could you please implement the changes that come through and send to the client? Alternatively if there is more that needs to be discussed before sending to Claudia, could you request more time & we can review & send the baseline timeline to ColPal tomorrow .
 
 
Critical Path-Tasks Impacting Schedule delivery of 3/28 :
 
V1 Build-8d
V1  feedback implemented-4d
V2 feedback implemented-4d
Narration recorded-5d
Narration implemented/Final Version finalized - 5d
 
With above tasks on the CP & having a US Holiday in Feb (2/17 Presidents day )
the current delivery is 4/4.
 
@
@Arvinder Kaur
 & 
@Chuck Adams
 can you confirm if 8 days is for the V1 build & 4 days per feedback implementation is valid or can the duration be reduced?
 
@Catalina De Sanctis
, could you confirm if 10 days for VO recording & implementation is accurate? It would be great if recording the English VO & implementation into the ML can be turned around in less than 10 days.
 
Thank you all! 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)

LCW

Good morning, Evening ladies,
 
Here is client’s response (Claudia/HR). Chuck advised we will discuss on ALL STAFF MEETING TODAY.
Indeed, tittle MATTERS. Glad we caught it.
 
 
Hello Patricia :
 
I am copying Jesma to bring her into the loop & please see my comments in blue to your questions:
 
1.
   
First, as I am reviewing original SOW to determine budget. I see that tittle is “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition" vs “Rewards & Recognition”. The latter came up during our last call. Recognition=Praises, email, public announcements but Rewards= Tangible perks in addition to salary. When discuss goals, objectives and outcomes expected we can confirm. 
I will say we should  keep the title as Managing Bias in Rewards & Recogntion" since internally we usually talk about Rewards & Recognition and not Compensation & Recognition but  we will definitely discuss the  specific content to be included.
2.
   
We spoke about Q1 to work on this ML. Do you have launch date in mind in Q1 or Q2? 
The sooner the better , so ideally Q1 still not an specific date
3.
   
Who will benefit from this ML, current employees, or new hire ONLY?  
Current employees
 
See you at the meeting!
 
Best,

Hi Team,
 
Below is the first draft of the work breakdown to lift this microlearning build from scratch. Please provide your feedback in a different color.  We can certainly break each milestone/task further into subtasks so we can provide the best calrity to the client in their project plan. 
 
@Arvinder Kaur
 Your initials are bolded to show where I understood you come in. Please feel free to ask questions and provide your feedback as you are the design/programming lead for this project. 
TENTATIVE-High Level Tasks to create & deliver ML from Scratch:
1.client needs analysis
2.Research
3.Content creation-word doc-
4.Client content review & approval of outline
5. Edit according to feedback
5.Send word doc to 
AK
 who will then scope design
6.Incorporate approved content into ML build-RISE 
AK
 
DON’T WE WANT AK TO DELIVER ENGLISH ML FIRST before #7??? 
7.Programmer Deliver course content to 5x languages translations-
AK
8.Translations QA
9.Submit changes to course content back to programmer for review-
AK
10.Programmer incorporates changes-
AK
11.Final translations approval
12.Submit final files to client
 
Once this is finalized, I'll revise and input into a project plan with timeline.
Please provide feedback by
 EOD Tuesday
Thanks!

Hi team,
I have attached a baseline schedule built for the 
English
 
Micro Learning/ Rewards & Recognition
 and need to gain clarity on durations for some tasks that are on the critical path to see if we can reign in the schedule to ensure delivery of 
3/28.
 
As Patricia OOO, 
@Chuck Adams
 can you please review, provide comments or approval?
Also, once the below items have been addressed, I will update with schedule edits & Gantt along with any comments you have and send to the client. Please note, I am offline within the next hour and 10 min so if I do not see responses within that time I could log back on, update & send by 1/27 6/7pm EST. 
If that is too late , could you please implement the changes that come through and send to the client? Alternatively if there is more that needs to be discussed before sending to Claudia, could you request more time & we can review & send the baseline timeline to ColPal tomorrow .
Critical Path-Tasks Impacting Schedule delivery of 3/28 :
V1 Build-8d
V1  feedback implemented-4d
V2 feedback implemented-4d
Narration recorded-5d
Narration implemented/Final Version finalized - 5d
With above tasks on the CP & having a US Holiday in Feb (2/17 Presidents day )
the current delivery is 4/4.
@
@Arvinder Kaur
 & 
@Chuck Adams
 can you confirm if 8 days is for the V1 build & 4 days per feedback implementation is valid or can the duration be reduced?
@Catalina De Sanctis
, could you confirm if 10 days for VO recording & implementation is accurate? It would be great if recording the English VO & implementation into the ML can be turned around in less than 10 days.
Thank you all! 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

subject: RE: Patricia Engagement
body:
Hi, Patricia… Thank you for the time you’ve put into this detailed response. I would expect nothing less.
 
Let’s chat if you have time tomorrow morning. I’d like to more deeply understand your concerns.
 
Chuck

From:
 Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, January 27, 2025 8:54 AM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; pcoleman azworldconnections.com <pcoleman@azworldconnections.com>
Subject:
 RE: Patricia Engagement
 
Good morning, Chuck,
 
Thank you once again for the time and effort you put into drafting the SOW monetary percentage-based engagement. I truly appreciate the trust you’ve placed in me and the meaningful work we’ve accomplished together over the past year.
 
After thoughtful reflection, I have decided that I will not be able to accept this opportunity as presented although I applaud you on the creativity to come up with this plan.
 
While I deeply value the experiences and opportunities, I’ve had at LCW, I believe that the proposed engagement does not align with my professional goals, expertise, or the financial sustainability I require.
 
I understand the financial challenges LCW is navigating, and I admire the resilience and dedication being shown during these times. 
 
In light of this, I believe reverting to my prior engagement structure (before the Senior Consultant offer in January 2024) is the best fit for my skillset and bottom line. This structure enables me to bring the greatest value as a facilitator, trainer, speaker, and executive coach, leveraging my IDI Q.A. certification and extensive experience.
 
I recognize that the agreement signed a year ago has now expired on January 24th. To ensure a smooth transition, I will take the time this week to clean up files, update Dropbox, and prepare a final update on all clients which at this time should be managed by the Full-time team and not external consultants.
 
I will do this 
pro bono
 in the next 48hrs as a gesture of goodwill and appreciation for our time working together.
 
Please note: My out-of-office message for my LCW email is active and professionally directs senders to you, as has been done in the past when I’ve been unavailable.
 
This decision was not made lightly, and I hope it will be respected. I am grateful for the opportunities I’ve had to contribute to LCW and the trust you’ve shown in me.
 
I look forward to staying connected and wish you and the entire LCW team the best as you move forward.
 
Respectfully,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

subject: RE: Patricia Engagement
body:
Good morning, Chuck,
 
Thank you once again for the time and effort you put into drafting the SOW monetary percentage-based engagement. I truly appreciate the trust you’ve placed in me and the meaningful work we’ve accomplished together over the past year.
 
After thoughtful reflection, I have decided that I will not be able to accept this opportunity as presented although I applaud you on the creativity to come up with this plan.
 
While I deeply value the experiences and opportunities, I’ve had at LCW, I believe that the proposed engagement does not align with my professional goals, expertise, or the financial sustainability I require.
 
I understand the financial challenges LCW is navigating, and I admire the resilience and dedication being shown during these times. 
 
In light of this, I believe reverting to my prior engagement structure (before the Senior Consultant offer in January 2024) is the best fit for my skillset and bottom line. This structure enables me to bring the greatest value as a facilitator, trainer, speaker, and executive coach, leveraging my IDI Q.A. certification and extensive experience.
 
I recognize that the agreement signed a year ago has now expired on January 24th. To ensure a smooth transition, I will take the time this week to clean up files, update Dropbox, and prepare a final update on all clients which at this time should be managed by the Full-time team and not external consultants.
 
I will do this 
pro bono
 in the next 48hrs as a gesture of goodwill and appreciation for our time working together.
 
Please note: My out-of-office message for my LCW email is active and professionally directs senders to you, as has been done in the past when I’ve been unavailable.
 
This decision was not made lightly, and I hope it will be respected. I am grateful for the opportunities I’ve had to contribute to LCW and the trust you’ve shown in me.
 
I look forward to staying connected and wish you and the entire LCW team the best as you move forward.
 
Respectfully,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

Thanks Nicole.
 
Yes I know Vickil.
 I will add this to my reflection of next steps due Monday as part of new engagement offer.
 
Based on this:
Global head of HR, 2 HR Leaders - who Vicki is working with - one person is very particular
She committed to 6 IDIs - debrief + follow up coaching session with each leader (2 sessions)
There may be an additional 5-10 IDI packages for leaders
What do you anticipate as far as quantity of IDI debriefs are they looking for and also how many coaching sessions following the debriefs. Looks like 5-10/Not much 
Vicki committed to a certain number of 
initial 
IDIs. I believe she did a few already & there are 5-10 left. But this is just the initial group, so I understood. They want to roll out more. 
What is the revenue passed on from Vicki to LCW? 
Not quite sure yet. Initially it could be around $8-$17k for IDIs & coaching. There would be an initial training, perhaps valued at $5,500. Vicki seems pretty sure there will be more work needed.
 
Give me the weekend to consider all scenarios.

Cc:

Subject:
 New opportunity
 
Hi Patricia,
 
Thank you for your continued grace working with LCW. I know this is a difficult time for all of us.
 
I want to give you a heads up about a new opportunity that we have coming in....and I hope you will take this 
🙂
.
Please confirm if you are OK to take this on. (
My email below assumes you are).
 
Do you know Vicki Hudson? I've worked with her in the past in the intercultural world. Well, she is handing us an opportunity that she is bringing us. She has started an engagement with a company but has to stop for personal reasons.
The immediate details are as follows:
Client: NTT Data 
https://www.nttdata.com/global/en/
Vicki has been doing an IDI package for leaders that includes:
1 hour IDI debrief + 1 hour executive coaching session
She's not sure how many more they need, but there may be an additional 5-10 IDI packages for leaders
The IDIs might be for folks in Asia 
The client wants to also do Cultural Competence training for the Executive Leadership Team, but she doesn't know exactly what that will look like yet
Not sure if you know but we used to sell IDIs along with our BCI training; just a thought - they may not need this
They will also likely continue to do more IDIs ongoing
They need someone who gets global/intl work (you 
🙂
)
They want to spread cultural competence throughout the org, so Vicki thinks there will be more work down the road
Additional notes that I took from my call with Vicki that we can talk about once Vicki confirms this handover to us:
Vicki is working w exec ldship team. They manage regionally & globally.
She did listening tours - mostly with senior leaders
The company has a lot of issues - some say the CEO is US centric, but others say he's dedicated to DEI
Vicki reported findings & made recommendations to exec ldshp team that included training & IDI
Might want ldsp training in Singapore.
Vicki Recommended IDI + GlobeSmart or Country Navigator
Most who've taken the IDI so far are in minimization, but some below & some above
Global head of HR, 2 HR Leaders - who Vicki is working with - one person is very particular
She committed to 6 IDIs - debrief + follow up coaching session with each leader (2 sessions)
She wants to transfer seamlessly to LCW
Vicki would transfer knowledge, including her findings & recommendations
Next steps:
Vicki is giving the client our names & will introduce us both hopefully next week
We can have a call with the client & Vicki if needed to hand off to us
I would just be on initial call; you would lead
We will schedule a call with Vicki to discuss more in detail
I know this is a lot. LMK if you have any immediate questions.
Otherwise, I'll update you once I hear from Vicki.
 
Thank you!
Nicole
 
Nicole Barile

LCW

subject: RE:
body:
Thanks Patricia.  I like the way Lilly reframes DEI in her article and their honest reflection that some of our DEI efforts are no longer effective.
 
This will help us as we consider the changes we think are needed for ongoing success.
 
I appreciate you sharing.
 
Have a great weekend!
 
Stephen R. Cornejo Garcia 
(He, Him, El)
Global Head of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI)
 
Stephen.CornejoGarcia@ul.com
UL Solutions
 
 
From:
 Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, January 23, 2025 4:41 PM
To:
 Cornejo Garcia, Stephen R. <Stephen.CornejoGarcia@ul.com>; Dodson, Jermisha Y. <Jermisha.Dodson@ul.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 
 
Hello Stephen and Jermisha, 
 
I wanted to share with you 
this brand new HBR article by Lily Zheng
 which talks about the current landscape as an opportunity to reimagine or ‘reset’ DEI. 
 
Lily presents the FAIR acronym, which is substantially similar to DEI. However, I want to highlight Lily’s intriguing reframing of the ‘R’ which stands for representation. Framing representation as a matter of transparency, trust, and a track record of accountability. 
 
Here’s an excerpt:
If a product team aims to build products “for all people” but does not consult or include perspectives from a key audience in their design process, that audience lacks representation — even if a member of the product team shares an identity with that audience…. Representation is a matter of trust, not tokenism. While people may be slightly more inclined to trust those who share identities in common with them, trust is more dependent on the behavior and track record of those in power.
 
It’s possible for a leadership team made up entirely of women to be non-representative of women if none of the leaders take the effort to understand and advocate for the needs of the women they supposedly represent. On the other hand, it’s possible that a product team without direct experience living in rural communities might be very representative of rural communities due to frequent communication, active outreach, and ongoing efforts to understand and advocate for rural communities’ needs.
 
Thought you would appreciate. 
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

subject: Re: LCW invoice #24326/SONY INTERNATIONAL
body:
Hi Neeta,
It was nice meeting you!
I am confirming that we are OK agreeing to this purchase order:
 
https://www.sonypictures.com/corp/purchaseorder_tac.html
I know you are looking into payment terms. We would love 30 days 🙂 (our standard terms), but 45 days works for us as well.
Regarding ownership of work product (our content), if you can agree via mail, we would not need to sign any other agreement:
LCW retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property (referred to herein as “LCW IP”) in existence prior to the execution of this Agreement, and any new IP that is a derivative of LCW’s existing IP. No copyrightable or other Work Product created or provided by LCW pursuant to this Agreement is to be considered a work made for hire by Supplier, unless otherwise stated in an SOW. 
CLIENT retains sole ownership of all its intellectual property in existence prior to this agreement, including IP that may be incorporated by LCW into customized services or deliverables for CLIENT. 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks so much!
Nicole

Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Delivery Dates in Scoro - Please update by Friday EOD
 
Hi folks,
 
For reporting & forecasting, we must have all delivery dates related to deliverables in Scoro as accurate as possible. I believe you all have updated these, but I also know there's been a lot of hand offs lately of Quotes/SOW.
 
Please ensure each of your deliverables have a delivery date.
 
Even if you have to estimate, please do that.
For example, you may have TBD written in the delivery date field, because you know a program is happening in April, but you don't know when in April. If you know it's going to be in April please put the last day of April. If you know something's going to happen in Q3 but have no idea when in Q3, please enter the last day of Q3 in the delivery date field.... And so on.
 
Should you have any questions or need help, please lmk and/or put time on my calendar.
Thanks so much for your help with this!
Nicole

subject: RE: Patricia Engagement
body:
Good morning Chuck,
 
Thank you for sharing the offer to transition my current Sr Consultant agreement to a project-based engagement. I truly value the opportunity to work with LCW in my current role as an external consultant yet being included as part of the FT team in pipeline work past and to come. I very much appreciate your trust in my skill set and beyond.
 
This is an important decision, and I would like to take the weekend to carefully evaluate the details of the proposal as today January 24
th
 is my last retainer compensation day.
Based on offer it will end my 1 year  agreement which started end of January 2024 which would have marked a one year anniversary if I were full time. 
 
 
I’ll provide you with my response by Monday January 27 early morning before any meeting you may have with members of FT team to announce my new status and impact on work load. 
 
 
Thank you for your understanding and the continued opportunity to make a difference.
 
 
Best regards,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

 Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Patricia Engagement
 
Hi Patricia - Here is a summary of our conversation.
 
Patricia keeps open SOWs & clients below. 
For any open SOWs, she can get 20% of the deliverables when we get paid. This would look like:
Aug.2025 - Patricia gets $3,400 when ML billed (Colgate)
Aug.2026 - Patricia gets $3,200 when ML billed (Colgate)
TBD - Patricia gets $2,160 when Spotlights are billed (Sony)
For any new SOWs from these clients, she will get 20% of the SOW (minus COGS). 
Growing the client gets another SOW & 20% from that.
For IDIs,
 Individual: 
??? 
Group: 
???
For facilitation
, Patricia would be expected to lead facilitations on her own SOWs (where appropriate) as part of the 20% payment. LCW could pay her up to $250 per hour for facilitation outside of her own SOWs.
 
Please let me know if I captured anything incorrectly or incompletely. We will need to talk about UL if they come back in the next few days with the CCLP and Global Forum.
 
Chuck Adams

Chief Executive Officer
LCW

subject: RE: Delivery Dates in Scoro - Please update by Friday EOD
body:
I’ll double check mine
 
 
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, January 23, 2025 6:49 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>; Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>; Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>; Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Delivery Dates in Scoro - Please update by Friday EOD
 
Hi folks,
 
For reporting & forecasting, we must have all delivery dates related to deliverables in Scoro as accurate as possible. I believe you all have updated these, but I also know there's been a lot of hand offs lately of Quotes/SOW.
 
Please ensure each of your deliverables have a delivery date.
 
Even if you have to estimate, please do that.
For example, you may have TBD written in the delivery date field, because you know a program is happening in April, but you don't know when in April. If you know it's going to be in April please put the last day of April. If you know something's going to happen in Q3 but have no idea when in Q3, please enter the last day of Q3 in the delivery date field.... And so on.
 
Should you have any questions or need help, please lmk and/or put time on my calendar.
Thanks so much for your help with this!
Nicole
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

 Monday, January 20, 2025 2:00 PM
To:

>
Cc:
 Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: F/U Rewards & Recognition microlearning
 
Hello Patricia :
 
I am copying Jesma to bring her into the loop & please see my comments in blue to your questions:
 
1.
   
First, as I am reviewing original SOW to determine budget. I see that tittle is “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition" vs “Rewards & Recognition”. The latter came up during our last call. Recognition=Praises, email, public announcements but Rewards= Tangible perks in addition to salary. When discuss goals, objectives and outcomes expected we can confirm. 
I will say we should  keep the title as Managing Bias in Rewards & Recogntion" since internally we usually talk about Rewards & Recognition and not Compensation & Recognition but  we will definitely discuss the  specific content to be included.
2.
   
We spoke about Q1 to work on this ML. Do you have launch date in mind in Q1 or Q2? 
The sooner the better , so ideally Q1 still not an specific date
3.
   
Who will benefit from this ML, current employees, or new hire ONLY? Current employees
 
@Jesma Johnson
 any additional comment ?
 
Regards,
 
Claudia Solórzano A | Colgate-Palmolive Compañia
Human Resources
 
Nota: Mi día y horario de trabajo  puede o no coincidir con el tuyo, por tanto, no estás obligado(a) a responder este correo si te encuentras fuera de tu horario de trabajo.

I look forward to reconnecting with you on Friday January 24
th
. Can you add Chuck to the invitation please?? Thanks!
Couple of questions I’d like for you to run by Jesma before we meet.
 
 
1.
      
First, as I am reviewing original SOW to determine budget. I see that tittle is “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition" vs “Rewards & Recognition”. The latter came up during our last call. Recognition=Praises, email, public announcements but Rewards= Tangible perks in addition to salary. When discuss goals, objectives and outcomes expected we can confirm.
2.
      
We spoke about Q1 to work on this ML. Do you have launch date in mind in Q1 or Q2?
3.
      
Who will benefit from this ML, current employees, or new hire ONLY?
 
 
This can wait until Tuesday as we entering long holiday weekend in the US!
 
 
Thanks,Mil gracias!
 
Patricia 
 
 
Please note:
 LCW will be closed on Monday January 20
th
 in observance to Martin Luther King Jr’s Holiday which this year is also the U.S Presidential Inauguration day.

subject: ColPal Friday 1/24 call agenda RE: F/U Rewards & Recognition microlearning
body:
Good morning, 
 Today our main goald is to clarify tittle and expectations.
Chuck to explain process of instructional design and together we discuss timeline with Juri’s PM input.
 
Here is what we must discuss as differences between 
Reward & Recognition 
and
 Compensation & Recognition
 
Key Differences:
 
Aspect
Reward & Recognition
Compensation & Recognition
Monetary Focus
Rewards can be monetary but are often smaller, non-salary incentives.
Compensation is primarily salary and benefits.
Scope of Recognition
Broader, including informal and non-financial appreciation.
Recognition is tied to financial outcomes or job roles.
Purpose
To motivate and retain employees through targeted efforts.
To ensure employees feel valued and fairly compensated.
Engagement Approach
Short- and medium-term morale boosts and culture-building.
Longer-term employee satisfaction and retention.
 
 
PMC
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

 Friday, January 24, 2025 7:05 AM
To:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>; Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>; Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>; Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Catalina De Sanctis <c.desanctis@lcwmail.com>; Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Upcoming Online Availability Changes
 
Hello team,
 
Today going forward I will be limited in being online on Tuesdays and Fridays with hours being 8-11 am EST. The rest of the days I'll be online from 8am-12pm EST.  Tuesday's schedule is temporary just for the next month. I will let you know if that changes.
 
I will be flexible on days that client meetings must happen outside of these hours and adjust those days online availability to accommodate those meetings. 
 
Any one-on-one meetings will be ad hoc. 
 
As always if you need to reach me regarding an urgent need that cannot wait or be delegated you can reach me on WhatsApp: 703-504-8519
And text at 6572240067.
 
If you need me to be available online at later times in a day, please reach out to me and I will work with you. 
 
I am still sick with my respiratory system being mainly affected. I have never been this sick so I would appreciate your patience with me. I am functional though my ability to speak will be limited until I recover more hopefully sooner rather than later. I will reserve my speaking for client meetings and on rest of meetings I will reply in chat unless absolutely necessary to speak.
 
Thank you for your understanding & patience. And again please reach out to me if you would like to work with me on adjusting my availability for particular days even if it's just one offs.
 
Juri
